column4: Hi, I have just deleted /boot on natty. Any advice on how to restore it .. ?
reinstall grub
'grub-install /dev/sda' seems to have done it. I will have to try a reboot ..
can you send a uname -r ?
not from synaptic -- in LXTerminal. On a debian/ubuntu dual-boot, update-grub only recognises the debian kernel at the moment ..
/boot/ needs to be filled with linux-image System-map and initrd  i think
to me ?
I already have menuentry "Debian Linux" {
sorry, i though it was grub2
you might have to reinstall though
don't know if I want to cange it. grub-mkconfig makes a symlink .. ?
nevermind, i was talking about grub2
this time I'm getting 5 lines of 'sudo' usage advice ..
maybe its -e
it now goes into the 'joe' editor. Is that OK ? I'm getting washed-out text on the screen so can't see the details ..
I hate to be boring, but now I get sudo -i "grub-mkconfig > /boot/grub/grub.cfg"
there is a command sudo -? "mpla mpla mpla", but one can see it with "sudo --help" , i don't have sudo installed
i believe it should have made an entry, unless you're mistaking the partitions
yes it does
did you mix up the partitions? is /boot/ empty ?
Thanks - I might try a debian live CD ..
I don't know what it tells us, but 'sudo os-prober' recognises debian, but not ubuntu
os-prober does not recognise ubuntu .. que pasa ?
